meanings.definition: (Spanish) culmination, peak, height; (Latin America) the last straw
meanings.english_definition: (Spanish) culmination, peak, height; (Latin America) the last straw

examples.sentence: Este es el colmo de la paciencia.
Llegó al colmo de su carrera.
examples.translation: He reached the peak of his career.

collocations: ser el colmo (to be the last straw)
llegar al colmo (to reach the peak/culmination)

usage_notes.explanation: The word 'colmo' is primarily used in Spanish. It has two main meanings: culmination/peak and (especially in Latin America) the last straw. The context determines the meaning.

derivatives: colmar (to fill to the brim, to overflow)

readability_explanation.text: This word is specific to the Spanish language. It is not commonly used in English.

example_sentences.sentence: ¡Esto es el colmo! No puedo creer lo que pasó.
example_sentences.translation: This is the last straw! I can't believe what happened.

example_sentences.sentence: Su éxito fue el colmo de sus ambiciones.
example_sentences.translation: His success was the culmination of his ambitions.
